lines.text: Hey, what if... the statue isn't the only Stop Wizard in the room?
What? What're you gettin' at?
Like, what if the dead robber is a wizard, too?
We can't check for tattoos, but the implications of having a second Stop Wizard on the scene... it's worth looking into, right?
What makes you think he's a Stop Wizard?
Well, nothing, really, but what if he was? It'd totally change the story, right?
Like, maybe he cast Flesh to Stone on the wizard, instead of the other way around! Could've happened, right?
...He had a gun.
Huh?
If he had a spell he could cast to kill someone like that, why carry a gun?
Well, that's a good question! How about you add that to your hypothesis, and-
Mass Arrest Momentum, too. If you were a robber and you could cast that spell, why wouldn't you do it right away?
Just loot the place and scram without a fight?
Maybe it failed! Maybe they broke out, and... the guy in red had a status effect, so he used the gun on him, and Flesh to Stone on the other.
And then... after those two were dead, he messed something up, and... got himself... killed somehow?
You said breakin' free of that spell takes a... savin' constitution throw? If you're beefy and healthy, you can power through?
...and a couple of old men wouldn't have passed. Hm.
I'm just not convinced. It's an interestin' idea, but the scene just doesn't line up right.
If we run into more evidence for that hypothesis later, maybe we'll revisit it.
Ugh. Fine. I guess for now, we just assume this guy isn't magic?
